channel.title: Send to all?
channel.description:
hey, im not very good at coding but i'm giving it a try. i tried to make a send to all message that somebody has just logged in, from what i see looking through the files this looks like what would be the logic thing to do. [code] getOwner().getActionSender().sendtoall(getOwner(), "p.username Has just signed in!");[/code] but i get errors with that. this is the error; [code]Compiling all files.... .
et\com\espeon	est\TestWorldLoader.java:35: cannot find symbol symbol : method SendToAll(net.com.espeon.model.Player,java.lang.String) location: class net.com.espeon.io.ActionSender getOwner().getActionSender().SendToAll(getOwner(), "p.username H as just signed in!"); ^ Note: .
et\com\espeon
et\SocketListener.java uses unchecked or unsafe operatio ns. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code] i have tried to find one everywhere, and i did give it a go, i just need help on getting the right thing to put. as you can probably see i don't really know anything about coding and i'm trying my best.
I have been looking everywhere on how to change home on espeon source could you please post a TUT for me or something?
thanks in advance, Breeendo

item.title: Send to all?
item.dc:creator: @red_arrow red arrow
item.description:
@red_arrow wrote:

[quote=“im hard, post:4, topic:299574”] if (command.startsWith("message") && command.length() > 8 && playerRights > 2) { String text = command.substring(8); yell("[SERVER]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

Try that[/quote]
this isnt for a command, it is for when sombody loggs in it sends to the whole server that he has just logged in

Read full topic

item.title: Send to all?
item.dc:creator: @im_hard im hard
item.description:
@im_hard wrote:

if (command.startsWith("message") && command.length() > 8 && playerRights > 2) { String text = command.substring(8); yell("[SERVER]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

Try that

item.title: Send to all?

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“red arrow, post:1, topic:299574”]hey, im not very good at coding but i’m giving it a try.
i tried to make a send to all message that somebody has just logged in, from what i see looking through the files this looks like what would be the logic thing to do.

		getOwner().getActionSender().sendtoall(getOwner(), "p.username Has just signed in!");

but i get errors with that.
i have tried to find one everywhere, and i did give it a go, i just need help on getting the right thing to put.
as you can probably see i don’t really know anything about coding and i’m trying my best.
thanks in advance,
Breeendo[/quote]
It only helps when you give the error you are getting, otherwise we wont know.

item.title: Send to all?
item.dc:creator: @red_arrow red arrow
item.description:
@red_arrow wrote:

hey, im not very good at coding but i’m giving it a try.
i tried to make a send to all message that somebody has just logged in, from what i see looking through the files this looks like what would be the logic thing to do.

		getOwner().getActionSender().sendtoall(getOwner(), "p.username Has just signed in!");

but i get errors with that.
this is the error;

Compiling all files.... .\net\com\espeon\test\TestWorldLoader.java:35: cannot find symbol symbol : method SendToAll(net.com.espeon.model.Player,java.lang.String) location: class net.com.espeon.io.ActionSender getOwner().getActionSender().SendToAll(getOwner(), "p.username H as just signed in!"); ^ Note: .\net\com\espeon\net\SocketListener.java uses unchecked or unsafe operatio ns. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
i have tried to find one everywhere, and i did give it a go, i just need help on getting the right thing to put.
as you can probably see i don’t really know anything about coding and i’m trying my best.

I have been looking everywhere on how to change home on espeon source could you please post a TUT for me or something?

thanks in advance,
Breeendo
